Name: Bronze cat head
Description: Bronze head of a cat, the eyes formerly inlaid, and with holes for ear-rings. Such figures were produced in large numbers from the Late Period to the Roman Period. This is a fine example of the type. The cult centre of the cat-goddess Bastet, originally goddess of protective ointment, lay at Bubastis in the Delta, but images of her are found throughout Egypt after the tenth century BC.
